gurmukhi: Aimt isMG Aq hI blI bhuqu krXo sMgRwm ]inkis joiq hir so imlI ijau ins ko kr Bwn ]1255]
transliteration: Amit Singh At Hibalibahout(u) Daryo Sanraam|| Nikas(i) Jot(i) Har(i) So Milijio Nis Ko Kar Bhaan||1255||
translation: The mighty warrior Amit Singh had waged a terrible war; just as the light moves out from the sun and moon, in the same manner, his light, coming out from his body, merged in Lord-God.1255.

gurmukhi: Aaur ijqI pRiqnw Air kI iqnhUM jdubIr jo ju`Du kIXw ]ibnu BUpq Awn Ary n fry irs ko kir kY Aiq gwFo hIXw ]
transliteration: Aur Jitipratinaa Ar(i) Kitinhoon Jadoubeer Jo Juddh(u) Keedaa|| Bin(u) Bhoopat Aandare Na Dare Ris Ko Kar(i) Kai At(i) Gaddho Heeyaa||
translation: The remaining army of the enemy fought with Krishna; they even stood firmly without their king and in their fury, they strengthened their heart;

gurmukhi: imil Dwie pry hir pY Bt XoN kivqw Cib ko jsu mwn lIXw ]mwno rwq smY auf kIt pqMg ijau tUt pry Aivlok dIXw ]1256]
transliteration: Mil(i) Dhaae Dare Har(i) Pai Bhat Yon Kavitaa Chhab(i) Ko Jas(u) Maan Leeyaa|| Maano Raat Samai Ud Keet Patan Jio Toot Dare Avilok Deeyaa||1256||
translation: The army gathered together and fell upon Krishna just as during night, seeing the earthen lamp, the insects move towards it and fall upon it.1256.

gurmukhi: qb biRj BUKn KVgu gih Ar bhu dey igrwie ]eyk Ary iek rup lry iek rn Cwf prwie ]1257]
transliteration: Tab Brij Bhookhan Khadag(u) Gadh Ar Bahu Dae Giraae|| Ekdare Ik Roup Dare Ik Ran Chhaad Paraae||1257||
translation: Then Krishna, taking his sword in his hand, knocked down many of his enemies; someone fought someone stood firmly and many sped away.1257.

gurmukhi: Aimt isMG dl hirjU hXo ]hwhwkwr S`qR dl BXo ]auq qy sUr Asqu huie gXo ]pRwcI ids qy sis pRgtXo ]1258]
transliteration: Amit Singh Dal Har(i) Joo Hayo|| Haahaakaar Shattra Dal Bhayo|| Out Te Soor Ast(u) Hue Gado|| Praachidis Te Sas(i) Pragadyo||1258||
translation: Krishna destroyed the army of Amit Singh and there was great lamentation in the enemy’s army; on that side, the sun set and the moon arose in the east.1258.

gurmukhi: cwr jwm idn sMGr kIno ]bIrn ko blu huie gXo CIno ]do dl Awp Awip imil Dwey ]ieiq jdubIr bsq giH Awey ]1259]
transliteration: Chaar Jaam Din Sanhar Keeno|| Bderan Ko Bal(u) Hue Gado Grah(i) Aae||1259||
translation: The warriors were exhausted and weakened by the continuous fight during the whole day; both the armies started moving back and on this side, Krishna also returned home.1259.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry ju`Du pRbMDy Aimt isMG sYnw sihq bDih iDAwie smwpqm ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribacchitraa Naatak Granthe Krishnaavatdare Juddh(u) Prabandhe Amit Singh Sainaa Sahit Badhah(i) Dhiaae Samaaptam||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Amit Singh alongwith his army in warfare” in Krishnavatara in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of war with five kings
